name: Japanese Fried Rice with Edamame, Tofu and Hijiki Seaweed
description: Here‚Äòs my super easy, copycat recipe of Trader Joe‚Äòs Japanese Fried Rice with Edamame, Tofu, and Hijiki Seaweed! Keep the ingredients stocked in your pantry and make this delicious fried rice from scratch any time, any day. {Gluten-free and vegetarian/vegan}

video.description:
Super easy, copycat recipe for Trader Joe's popular Japanese Fried Rice with Edamame, Tofu, and Hijiki Seaweed! Keep the ingredients stocked in your kitchen, and you can make this delicious fried rice any time, any day.¬† This vegetable fried rice is also gluten-free.

RECIPE starts ‚ñ∂ 01:20

PRINT RECIPE ‚ñ∂ http://bit.ly/TJJapaneseFriedRice

Prep Time: 20 mins
Cook Time: 10 mins
Total: 30 mins
Servings: 2
 
Ingredients:

5 cups cooked Japanese short grain rice (use 2 rice cooker cups to make rice)
1 Tbsp dried hijiki seaweed
1 piece aburaage (deep-fried tofu pouch) (or Inariage (seasoned fried tofu pouch)
1 carrot (2.8 oz or 78 g)
¬Ω cup edamame (defrosted, pod discarded)(2.4 oz or 68 g)
1 Tbsp sesame oil

- For Seasonings - 
1 Tbsp sake
1 Tbsp granulated sugar
3 Tbsp mirin
3-4 Tbsp Kikkoman gluten-free tamari soy sauce (or regular soy sauce)

Instructions with step-by-step pics ‚ñ∂ http://bit.ly/TJJapaneseFriedRice


‚òÖ FOLLOW JUST ONE COOKBOOK ‚òÖ

recipeIngredient: ¬Ω cup edamame ((2.4 oz; shelled and defrosted))
3‚Äì4 Tbsp soy sauce ((I used Kikkoman Gluten-Free Tamari Soy Sauce))

recipeInstructions.text: Gather all the ingredients first. For the cooked rice, please note that 1¬Ω cups (300 g, 2 rice cooker cups) of uncooked Japanese short-grain rice yield 4‚Öì cups (660 g) of cooked rice. See how to cook short-grain rice with a¬†rice cooker,¬†pot over the stove,¬†Instant Pot, or¬†donabe. If you just cooked your steamed rice, transfer it to a baking sheet lined with parchment paper to cool it and let the moisture evaporate.
recipeInstructions.name: Gather all the ingredients first. For the cooked rice, please note that 1¬Ω cups (300 g, 2 rice cooker cups) of uncooked Japanese short-grain rice yield 4‚Öì cups (660 g) of cooked rice. See how to cook short-grain rice with a¬†rice cooker,¬†pot over the stove,¬†Instant Pot, or¬†donabe. If you just cooked your steamed rice, transfer it to a baking sheet lined with parchment paper to cool it and let the moisture evaporate.

recipeInstructions.text: Rehydrate 1 Tbsp dried hijiki seaweed in 1 cup water for 20 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Rehydrate 1 Tbsp dried hijiki seaweed in 1 cup water for 20 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Bring a small pot of water to a boil. Add 1 piece aburaage (deep-fried tofu pouch) in the boiling water and flip once. This step is optional, but it‚Äôs best to remove the oil from the aburaage. Transfer to a plate to let cool. Cut into thin strips and squeeze out the water.
recipeInstructions.name: Bring a small pot of water to a boil. Add 1 piece aburaage (deep-fried tofu pouch) in the boiling water and flip once. This step is optional, but it‚Äôs best to remove the oil from the aburaage. Transfer to a plate to let cool. Cut into thin strips and squeeze out the water.

recipeInstructions.text: Slice 1 carrot into slabs and then julienne strips.
recipeInstructions.name: Slice 1 carrot into slabs and then julienne strips.

recipeInstructions.text: Heat 1 Tbsp toasted sesame oil over medium heat in a large frying pan. When it‚Äôs hot, add the hijiki seaweed, aburaage, and carrot. Saut√© to coat with the oil.
recipeInstructions.name: Heat 1 Tbsp toasted sesame oil over medium heat in a large frying pan. When it‚Äôs hot, add the hijiki seaweed, aburaage, and carrot. Saut√© to coat with the oil.

recipeInstructions.text: Add 1 Tbsp sake, 1 Tbsp sugar, and 3 Tbsp mirin.
recipeInstructions.name: Add 1 Tbsp sake, 1 Tbsp sugar, and 3 Tbsp mirin.

recipeInstructions.text: Add 3‚Äì4 Tbsp soy sauce and mix all together.
recipeInstructions.name: Add 3‚Äì4 Tbsp soy sauce and mix all together.

recipeInstructions.text: Add ¬Ω cup edamame and 2‚Äì3 servings cooked Japanese short-grain rice (cooled). Break the rice into smaller pieces (as Japanese rice tends to stick together) with a wooden spatula.
recipeInstructions.name: Add ¬Ω cup edamame and 2‚Äì3 servings cooked Japanese short-grain rice (cooled). Break the rice into smaller pieces (as Japanese rice tends to stick together) with a wooden spatula.

recipeInstructions.text: Make sure the rice is not clumped together and that each grain is well coated with the seasonings. Once heated through, serve and enjoy immediately.
recipeInstructions.name: Make sure the rice is not clumped together and that each grain is well coated with the seasonings. Once heated through, serve and enjoy immediately.

review.reviewBody:
Hi Nami,

Thank you for this recipe. It's my son's favorite dish!
I'd love to make it for his birthday but I ran out of hijiki and I can't get hold of them on time.

Do you have a suggestion on what to use instead of hijiki? I have  a lot of Chinese shops around but Japanese ingredients are very limited.

Thank you.

I just wanted to thank you so very much for sharing this recipe!! I've always loved the TJ's rice, and I just started learning how to cook beyond a couple simple things. I've made it 4 times this week to use up all the aburaage pieces. It's eye-opening how we could recreate the exact taste at home so easily (and it tastes even better -- so addicting)! I can't wait to try out your other recipes!

I love this recipe ! I like to go meatless a few days a week so this was perfect. I used sweet short grain brown rice instead of white so I guess the taste might be a bit different but I loved it anyway.

Dear Nami-san, 

I just made this tonight accompanied with miso soup, it was very delicious! I didn't have hijiki and aburage, but I had bok choy, edamame, and some fish balls, it also worked! Oh, I added white sesame and seaweed shreddings at the end before eating, it was a very nice extra touch too. Thank you for the recipe!
Thank you for the recipe! I didn't have carrots so I had to skip the carrots but it turned out great!
I just made this! It is really delicious. Definitely a recipe I am going to make again.
